body:
### Summary

Hello,

the "architecture" directory keeps potentially superfluous information in homogeneous clusters.
Customisation via projections seems to affect only the path for the applications, not their modules.

### Rationale

Default convention:
````console
/opt/ohpc/pub/modules/linux-centos8-x86_64/gcc/9.3.0
````
Desired option:
````console
/opt/ohpc/pub/modules/zen2/gcc/9.3.0
````
Or even better:
````console
/modules/zen2/gcc/9.3.0
````

### Description

Spack 0.16.2 always includes the architecture directory in the module path, and it would be great if one could customise that, e.g. by limiting it to "target".
This would help to abbreviate the path in the user's view for "module av" in all situations, where the entire cluster is on Linux and is on the same OS level.
Is there any option for that i missed so far?



### Additional information

````console
spack --version
0.16.2-3869-81be31aee0
````

### General information

- [X] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Customise architecture directory in modulefile path
